(g)  "Work  Product"  means any and all Work and  other  items in any form           that Turpin, solely or with others, conceives of, modifies,  develops,
           contributes  to, or reduces to practice  during the period of Turpin's
           employment with the Company and which:

          (i)  relate,  directly  or  indirectly,  to the  Company's  present or
                future foreseeable Business or Research and Development; or

          (ii) result from any work performed by Turpin for the Company;

          whether or not such are made during or after working hours,  on or off
           the Company's premises.
perturbation.changed_text:
(g)  "Work  Product"  means any and all Work and  other  items in any form           that Turpin, solely or with others, conceives of, modifies,  develops,
           contributes  to, or reduces to practice  during the period of Turpin's association with the Company and which:

          (i)  relate,  directly  or  indirectly,  to the  Company's  present or
                future conceivable Business or Research and Development; or

          (ii) result from any tasks performed by Turpin for the Company;

          whether or not such are made during standard working hours,  on or off
           the Company's main premises.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'employment' is changed to 'association,' which is more ambiguous and could be interpreted to include periods beyond formal employment, making the scope of 'Work Product' ownership unclear. Replacing 'foreseeable' with 'conceivable' broadens the scope to any business imaginable, not just reasonably anticipated ones. Furthermore, 'work' is changed to 'tasks', and 'premises' is changed to 'main premises'. These changes make the definition of 'Work Product' overly broad and ambiguous, contradicting standard interpretations related to intellectual property ownership derived from employment.
perturbation.contradicted_law: British Columbia's intellectual property law and employment standards acts

4.   Assistance.  Turpin shall, at the Company's  request,  assist with, execute
      and   deliver   all   further   documents,   applications,    declarations,
      verifications,  submissions,  transfers  and  assignments  and do all other
      things requested by the Company, acting reasonably,  during the term hereof
      and  thereafter,  at the expense of the  Company,  but  without  additional
      compensation,  to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire,
      prosecute,  perfect,  enforce and/or maintain any and all right,  title and
      interest, in any country, in and to the Confidential Information,  the Work
      Product and the Intellectual Property Rights in same.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.   Assistance.  Turpin may, based on his availability, assist with, execute
      and   deliver  documents deemed necessary,  applications,    declarations,
      verifications,  submissions,  transfers  and  assignments  and do all other
      things requested by the Company, acting reasonably,  during the active term hereof
      and  thereafter for a one-year period,  at the expense of the  Company,  but  without  additional
      compensation if the employee finds it valuable enough,  to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire,
      prosecute,  perfect,  enforce and/or maintain any and all right,  title and
      interest, in any country, in and to the Confidential Information,  the Work
      Product and the Intellectual Property Rights in same.
perturbation.explanation: The original text dictates that Turpin 'shall' assist, implying a mandatory obligation. The modified text changes this to 'may, based on his availability' indicating a discretionary action, making the contractual obligation unenforceable. Also, it modifies the sentence: 'without additional compensation, to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire' to 'without additional compensation if the employee finds it valuable enough, to enable the Company or its nominees to apply for, acquire' creating further ambiguity.
